net.java.jddac.common.util
Class Status

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.common.util.Status

public class Status
extends java.lang.Object

A class to accumulates status messages into a form that is queryable for use in GUIs and J2ME debugging. This class is of most use in J2ME environments where debugging is difficult. Objects that implement the Status.Register interface can provide information about their state in a manner that is independant of any display limitations. The Statusclass keeps a static list of all objects which have registered themselves by calling addItem.

Method Detail

addItem

public static int addItem(Status.Report obj)
Add an item to the list of status report capable objects. This function returns a value so it can be easily used in static initializers.

Parameters:
obj - - the object to add to the list.
Returns:
an integer of no significance.

removeItem

public static void removeItem(Status.Report obj)
Remove an object previously added to the list.

Parameters:
obj - - the object to remove.

getReport

public static java.lang.String getReport()
Sequence thru all of the items in the list and return a String with the contents of their 'reports'.

Returns:
a String containing the report for all items.
